form.name: form1

div.p: On Monday, April 20th, Governor DeWine announced the closing of schools for the remainder of the 2019 – 2020 school year. It is apparent, we need to develop alternative plans for our traditional end of year activities that will address the safety and well being of our students, parents, community members and staff. We will communicate any changes/revisions via One Call, Social Media and on our district web page.

div.span: The Thompson family, showing their appreciation of the district, stand waiting with "Thank You!" signs!!!
Students...please know that we are MISSING YOU and HOPE TO SEE YOU SOON!!!
Jr. High - Claire Ames & Ephraim Meyer (not pictured) and HS - Lexus Wilder & Connor Butler
Bright Elementary Students recognized during the October Board Meeting for their outstanding scores on State AIR testing.
Mason Greenwood, Madison McMullen, Siarra Kipp, Marley Gobin, Nicholai Wing, Carly Stone, Vivian Watson, Austin Richards

img.alt: Bright Elementary Students recognized during the October Board Meeting for their outstanding scores on State AIR testing.

div.span: The Bright Local Board of Education recently recognized several teachers for outstanding AIR test scores.

Honored at the meeting were Jackie Broughton, Jennifer Fraysier, Sharon Bick, Natasha Shelton, Katie Pollard, John Combs and Jamie Lanham. Also photographed are Administrators, Mr. Jason Iles and Mr Mike Bick.

img.alt: The Bright Local Board of Education recently recognized several teachers for outstanding AIR test scores.

div.span: Thanks to the Roy W. Wilson Post 694 American Legion and Post Commander Chuck Emery!
Whiteoak was presented new American Flags for each classroom on August 26, 2019

div.span: Thanks to the Roy W. Wilson Post 694 American Legion and Highland Co. Veterans Service Office!
Whiteoak was presented a new Flag of the United States of America and a POW/MIA Flag on January 29, 2018

img.alt: Thanks to the Roy W. Wilson Post 694 American Legion and Highland Co. Veterans Service Office

span.p: A BIG SHOUT OUT to the Southern Highland Joint Fire District, along with Chuck Wait Tire, The Old Y, Nutrien Ag and H & R Block (Mt. Orab) who have offered to pay the remaining $15 for Senior Yard Signs, so every Whiteoak Senior will have one. If any Senior/Parent wants to use a picture other than their Senior Composite, please email it to nancymaysphotography@yahoo.com by this Friday, April 24th. We are moving up this date so we can get the signs a week sooner.

p.style: margin-top: 0pt; line-height: 11.7px; margin-bottom: 6pt; margin-left: 0in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed

span.p: Thanks again for supporting our Whiteoak Seniors!

h3.a: Bright Elementary Students continue practicing at home "The Pledge of Allegiance"

div.span: With the second learning packet that was sent home, each student received a US Flag and The Pledge of Allegiance. Bright Local wants to give a BIG THANK YOU to the Roy W. Wilson Post 694 American Legion for purchasing 450 flags to make this possible.

h3.a: Class of 2020 - Senior Yard Signs....ORDER NOW!

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: #1c1e21; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;font-size:16px
font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1c1e21; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Would you like to purchase a Yard Sign for your Senior? Nancy Mays Photography is offering to make signs with your Senior’s Composite Picture or another Senior Photo of your choice. (If it’s taken by a professional photographer, you must have a signed release for that photo). If you supply your own photo, you must email it to

font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1c1e21; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif

span.span: Certainly, the COVID-19 crisis has had a dramatic impact on all our lives. Keeping our children and community members safe is the top priority. Two areas of focus have emerged during this crisis, continuing the learning process and providing nutritious meals to our children in need. Two rounds of learning packets with traditional paper/pencil activities have been distributed to our students. Drop boxes, for completed work, have been placed in front of each of our buildings.

h3.a: Bright Local Pre-School and Kindergarten Registration for the 20-21 School Year

span.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: During these difficult times, the Bright Local School District is setting tentative dates for registration for both Preschool and Kindergarten. Be aware that these dates may be subject to change based on any news forthcoming regarding the COVID 19 virus.

h3.a: Revised CCP Eligibility/Guidance in Response to COVID-19
